issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

attachment.filename: Simulator Screen Shot - iPad Air 2 - 2019-01-21 at 11.02.54.png

fields.summary: Audio not working when device is muted

comments.body:
[~morahman] Are you talking about ringer button ?
Ringer button do not have to do anything with media volume. 
I tried on iPhone 6 plus using Xcode, it is working fine. I mean whether we on or off ringer button it is not affecting audio.
Can you try with some other device?

Hello, sorry for the late reply. People using our apps are also using apps like facebook, youtube, vimeo etc.. audio on these apps works even if device is muted. People are thinking that our apps is bugged. People are using iPad BTW, device is muted using the settings area is iOS. Thanks.

[~mark@grandora.net], Can you share your device model and version? Also, try with some other device then let us know.

Thanks!

Hello,

I have here iPad Air 2 model number MNVP2CL/A and iOS version 12.1.1(16C50). We have reports that even with latest iPad this issue is happening. 

- Mark

Hi Mark,
It seems this is a normal behaviour with UIWebView, which we are using till SDK 7.5.x for implementing TiUIWebView. Same can be seen in attached native iOS app.
In WKWebView this behaviour has been changed (Ringer button is not affecting volume). We have moved to WKWebView for implementing TiUIWebView from SDK 8.0.0+, which is planned to release soon. So from 8.0.0+ it will automatically solved.

You can use [Ti.WKWebView|https://github.com/appcelerator-modules/Ti.WKWebView] module which is based on WKWebView.
Thanks!

[~mark@grandora.net],

Do you manage to try using Ti.WKWebView module as suggested by Vijay?

Thanks

Hello,
We haven't heard back from you since our last response. I thought Iâ€™d check in to see how things are progressing on your end. Did you manage to try Ti.WKWebView module?
My apologies for not responding immediately, I'm traveling as of the moment. I'll check on it this weekend. I'll keep you guys posted.
[~mark@grandora.net],Thanks for your feedback. Will be waiting for your reply.

Hello, it looks like I can't check this yet if it's working on SDK 8 because I got so many errors when using SDK 8.  I'm having export problems. Please see attached screenshot.

!Simulator Screen Shot - iPad Air 2 - 2019-01-21 at 11.02.54.png|thumbnail!

Hello [~mark@grandora.net],

Thanks for your feedback. Did you experience same error using Ti.WKWebView module on 7.5.0.GA?

Hello,â€¨
We haven't heard back from you since our last response. I am just following up to check the status of this case and if you need further help on it.Â
